p: Extract of tubers yields albumin, butanedioic acid, hydroquinone, lesoglossin, militarrin, pyranoside, pyrocatechol, and volatile oil. The antioxidant property of compounds obtained from the plant finds its use in the treatment of different human diseases. Indole alkaloids, phenolics (stilbene, e.g., resveratrol), and saponins along with ascorbic acid, phyllo- and naphthloquinones, glucomannan, and carotenoids [ 50] form the active constituents of D. hatagirea. Dactylorhins A-E (glycosidic compounds: dactylorhin A (C 40H 56O 22) , dactylorhin B (C 40H 57O 23) , dactylorhin C (C 14H 24O 10) , dactylorhin D (C 27H 40O 17) , dactylorhin E (C 27H 40O 17)) and dactyloses A-B (glycosidic compounds: dactylose A, dactylose B, C 12H 16O 6) obtained from D. hatagirea exhibit a wide range of pharmacological activities [ 80] ( Table 3).
